definition: to overflow/transverse flow/to flow over/cross flow
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
tears and mucus flowing profusely/sniveling/in a tragic state
to be overflowing with tears (idiom)

sentences.english: The experiment was carried out using a transversally excited flow CO2 laser.
sentences.chinese: 该实验是用横流电激励CO2激光器进行的。

sentences.english: The cross-flow influence the flow field of downstream outflow.
sentences.chinese: 横流对通道下游孔内流场影响较大。

sentences.english: The fan induces air through the entire louver face of a crossflow tower.
sentences.chinese: 诱导风机空气在整个百叶窗面对横流塔。

sentences.english: Being vex'd a sea nourish'd with lovers' tears: What is it else?
sentences.chinese: 烦恼时，爱是情侣泪水横流的海洋。爱还是什么？

sentences.english: Materialistic, warm taste moved closer, love is tapering off.
sentences.chinese: 物欲横流，暖味越走越近，爱情却渐行渐远。

sentences.english: We are all changed, in this materialistic age.
sentences.chinese: 我们都变了，在这个物欲横流的时代。

sentences.english: Investigations on an impinging jet under the influence of crossflow are carried out in this dissertation.
sentences.chinese: 本文的研究对象为受横流影响的冲击射流。

sentences.english: When the seas are in turmoil, heroes are on their mettle.
sentences.chinese: 沧海横流，方显出英雄本色。

sentences.english: Can the torn and bloody victim "love" the blood-splashed jaws that rend him limb from limb?
sentences.chinese: 鲜血横流的受害者能否“爱”那将他撕碎的血口？

sentences.english: The utility model belongs to the field of transverse flow direct contact water showering cooling towers.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型属于横流直接接触水淋冷却塔领域。

sentences.english: The floods surged over the village.
It's more of a "high money" age.
sentences.chinese: 现在是一个物欲横流金钱至上的时代。

definition: to splash across/to splatter
(of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere
to splash/to spatter
to gush/to spurt
blood
to drip/to trickle/to shed (tears)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to bubble out/to squirt
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
almost/nearly going to
splash
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
